name: List users in account
description: A paginated list of users associated with this account.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list. Must be at least 3 characters.Note that the API will prefer matching on canonical user ID if the ID has a numeric form. It will only search against other fields if non-numeric in form, or if the numeric value doesn’t yield any matches. Queries by administrative users will search on SIS ID, Integration ID, login ID, name, or email address

parameters.name: enrollment_type
parameters.description: When set, only return users enrolled with the specified course-level base role. This can be a base role type of ‘student’, ‘teacher’, ‘ta’, ‘observer’, or ‘designer’.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The column to sort results by.Allowed values:username,email,sis_id,integration_id,last_login

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order to sort the given column by.Allowed values:asc,desc

parameters.name: include_deleted_users
parameters.description: When set to true and used with an account context, returns users who have deleted pseudonyms for the context

name: List the activity stream
description: Returns the current user’s global activity stream, paginated.

parameters.name: only_active_courses
parameters.description: If true, will only return objects for courses the user is actively participating in

name: Activity stream summary
description: Returns a summary of the current user’s global activity stream.

parameters.name: only_active_courses
parameters.description: If true, will only return objects for courses the user is actively participating in

name: List the TODO items
description: A paginated list of the current user’s list of todo items.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: “ungraded_quizzes”Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list. These will be returned under aquizkey instead of anassignmentkey in response elements.Allowed values:ungraded_quizzes

example_response: [{'type':'grading',// an assignment that needs grading'assignment':{..assignment object..},'ignore':'.. url ..','ignore_permanently':'.. url ..','html_url':'.. url ..','needs_grading_count':3,// number of submissions that need grading'context_type':'course',// course|group'course_id':1,'group_id':null,},{'type'=>'submitting',// an assignment that needs submitting soon'assignment'=>{..assignment object..},'ignore'=>'.. url ..','ignore_permanently'=>'.. url ..','html_url':'.. url ..','context_type':'course','course_id':1,},{'type'=>'submitting',// a quiz that needs submitting soon'quiz'=>{..quiz object..},'ignore'=>'.. url ..','ignore_permanently'=>'.. url ..','html_url':'.. url ..','context_type':'course','course_id':1,},]

name: List counts for todo items
description: Counts of different todo items such as the number of assignments needing grading as well as the number of assignments needing submitting.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: “ungraded_quizzes”Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list. These will be returned under aquizkey instead of anassignmentkey in response elements.Allowed values:ungraded_quizzes

name: List upcoming assignments, calendar events
description: A paginated list of the current user’s upcoming events.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: the student’s ID

parameters.name: observed_user_id
parameters.description: Return missing submissions for the given observed user. Must be accompanied by course_ids[]. The user making the request must be observing the observed user in all the courses specified by course_ids[].

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: “planner_overrides”Optionally include the assignment’s associated planner override, if it exists, for the current user. These will be returned under aplanner_overridekey“course”Optionally include the assignments’ coursesAllowed values:planner_overrides,course

parameters.name: filter[]
parameters.description: “submittable”Only return assignments that the current user can submit (i.e. filter out locked assignments)“current_grading_period”Only return missing assignments that are in the current grading periodAllowed values:submittable,current_grading_period

parameters.name: course_ids[]
parameters.description: Optionally restricts the list of past-due assignments to only those associated with the specified course IDs. Required if observed_user_id is passed.

name: Create a user
description: Create and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.

parameters.name: user[name]
parameters.description: The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading. Required if this is a self-registration.

parameters.name: user[short_name]
parameters.description: User’s name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, and comments.

parameters.name: user[sortable_name]
parameters.description: User’s name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.

parameters.name: user[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones areIANA time zonesor friendlierRuby on Rails time zones.

parameters.name: user[locale]
parameters.description: The user’s preferred language, from the list of languages Canvas supports. This is in RFC-5646 format.

parameters.name: user[terms_of_use]
parameters.description: Whether the user accepts the terms of use. Required if this is a self-registration and this canvas instance requires users to accept the terms (on by default).If this is true, it will mark the user as having accepted the terms of use.

parameters.name: user[skip_registration]
parameters.description: Automatically mark the user as registered.If this is true, it is recommended to set"pseudonym[send_confirmation]"to true as well. Otherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their account creation.The users communication channel confirmation can be skipped by setting"communication_channel[skip_confirmation]"to true as well.

parameters.name: pseudonym[unique_id]
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: pseudonym[password]
parameters.description: User’s password. Cannot be set during self-registration.

parameters.name: pseudonym[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: SIS ID for the user’s account. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions.

parameters.name: pseudonym[integration_id]
parameters.description: Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions. The Integration ID is a secondary identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.

parameters.name: pseudonym[send_confirmation]
parameters.description: Send user notification of account creation if true. Automatically set to true during self-registration.

parameters.name: pseudonym[force_self_registration]
parameters.description: Send user a self-registration style email if true. Setting it means the users will get a notification asking them to “complete the registration process” by clicking it, setting a password, and letting them in. Will only be executed on if the user does not need admin approval. Defaults to false unless explicitly provided.

parameters.name: pseudonym[authentication_provider_id]
parameters.description: The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider. Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the first matching provider).

parameters.name: communication_channel[type]
parameters.description: The communication channel type, e.g. ‘email’ or ‘sms’.

parameters.name: communication_channel[address]
parameters.description: The communication channel address, e.g. the user’s email address.

parameters.name: communication_channel[confirmation_url]
parameters.description: Only valid for account admins. If true, returns the new user account confirmation URL in the response.

parameters.name: communication_channel[skip_confirmation]
parameters.description: Only valid for site admins and account admins making requests; If true, the channel is automatically validated and no confirmation email or SMS is sent. Otherwise, the user must respond to a confirmation message to confirm the channel.If this is true, it is recommended to set"pseudonym[send_confirmation]"to true as well. Otherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their account creation.

parameters.name: force_validations
parameters.description: If true, validations are performed on the newly created user (and their associated pseudonym) even if the request is made by a privileged user like an admin. When set to false, or not included in the request parameters, any newly created users are subject to validations unless the request is made by a user with a ‘manage_user_logins’ right. In which case, certain validations such as ‘require_acceptance_of_terms’ and ‘require_presence_of_name’ are not enforced. Use this parameter to return helpful json errors while building users with an admin request.

parameters.name: enable_sis_reactivation
parameters.description: When true, will first try to re-activate a deleted user with matching sis_user_id if possible. This is commonly done withuserandcommunication_channelso that the default communication_channel is also restored.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: If you’re setting the password for the newly created user, you can provide this param with a valid URL pointing into this Canvas installation, and the response will include a destination field that’s a URL that you can redirect a browser to and have the newly created user automatically logged in. The URL is only valid for a short time, and must match the domain this request is directed to, and be for a well-formed path that Canvas can recognize.

parameters.name: initial_enrollment_type
parameters.description: ‘observer` if doing a self-registration with a pairing code. This allows setting the password during user creation.

parameters.name: pairing_code[code]
parameters.description: If provided and valid, will link the new user as an observer to the student’s whose pairing code is given.

name: Update user settings.
description: Update an existing user’s settings.

parameters.name: manual_mark_as_read
parameters.description: If true, require user to manually mark discussion posts as read (don’t auto-mark as read).

parameters.name: release_notes_badge_disabled
parameters.description: If true, hide the badge for new release notes.

parameters.name: collapse_global_nav
parameters.description: If true, the user’s page loads with the global navigation collapsed

parameters.name: collapse_course_nav
parameters.description: If true, the user’s course pages will load with the course navigation collapsed.

parameters.name: hide_dashcard_color_overlays
parameters.description: If true, images on course cards will be presented without being tinted to match the course color.

parameters.name: comment_library_suggestions_enabled
parameters.description: If true, suggestions within the comment library will be shown.

parameters.name: elementary_dashboard_disabled
parameters.description: If true, will display the user’s preferred class Canvas dashboard view instead of the canvas for elementary view.

description: Returns all custom colors that have been saved for a user.

parameters.description: The hexcode of the color to set for the context, if you choose to pass the hexcode as a query parameter rather than in the request body you should NOT include the ‘#’ unless you escape it first.

parameters.description: To set the user’s avatar to point to an external url, do not include a token and instead pass the url here. Warning: For maximum compatibility, please use 128 px square images.

parameters.description: To set the state of user’s avatar. Only valid for account administrator.Allowed values:none,submitted,approved,locked,reported,re_reported

parameters.description: Sets a title on the user profile. (SeeGet user profile.) Profiles must be enabled on the root account.

parameters.name: user[bio]

parameters.name: user[pronunciation]
parameters.description: Sets name pronunciation on the user profile. (SeeGet user profile.) Profiles and name pronunciation must be enabled on the root account.

parameters.name: user[pronouns]
parameters.description: Sets pronouns on the user profile. Passing an empty string will empty the user’s pronouns Only Available Pronouns set on the root account are allowed Adding and changing pronouns must be enabled on the root account.

parameters.name: user[event]
parameters.description: Suspends or unsuspends all logins for this user that the calling user has permission toAllowed values:suspend,unsuspend

parameters.name: override_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness

name: Terminate all user sessions
description: Terminates all sessions for a user. This includes all browser-based sessions and all access tokens, including manually generated ones. The user can immediately re-authenticate to access Canvas again if they have the current credentials. All integrations will need to be re-authorized.

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: The pandata events appKey for this mobile app

name: Log users out of all mobile apps
description: Permanently expires any active mobile sessions, forcing them to re-authorize.

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: The pandata events appKey for this mobile app

name: Merge user into another user
description: Merge a user into another user. To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users. This should be considered irreversible. This will delete the user and move all the data into the destination user.

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: The pandata events appKey for this mobile app

name: Split merged users into separate users
description: Merged users cannot be fully restored to their previous state, but this will attempt to split as much as possible to the previous state. To split a merged user, the caller must have permissions to manage all of the users logins. If there are multiple users that have been merged into one user it will split each merge into a separate user. A split can only happen within 180 days of a user merge. A user merge deletes the previous user and may be permanently deleted. In this scenario we create a new user object and proceed to move as much as possible to the new user. The user object will not have preserved the name or settings from the previous user. Some items may have been deleted during a user_merge that cannot be restored, and/or the data has become stale because of other changes to the objects since the time of the user_merge.

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: The pandata events appKey for this mobile app

name: List avatar options
description: A paginated list of the possible user avatar options that can be set with the user update endpoint. The response will be an array of avatar records. If the ‘type’ field is ‘attachment’, the record will include all the normal attachment json fields; otherwise it will include only the ‘url’ and ‘display_name’ fields. Additionally, all records will include a ‘type’ field and a ‘token’ field. The following explains each field in more detail

parameters.name: start_time

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: “needs_grading_count”: Optional information to include with each Course. When needs_grading_count is given, and the current user has grading rights, the total number of submissions needing grading for all assignments is returned.“syllabus_body”: Optional information to include with each Course. When syllabus_body is given the user-generated html for the course syllabus is returned.“public_description”: Optional information to include with each Course. When public_description is given the user-generated text for the course public description is returned.“total_scores”: Optional information to include with each Course. When total_scores is given, any student enrollments will also include the fields ‘computed_current_score’, ‘computed_final_score’, ‘computed_current_grade’, and ‘computed_final_grade’, as well as (if the user has permission) ‘unposted_current_score’, ‘unposted_final_score’, ‘unposted_current_grade’, and ‘unposted_final_grade’ (see Enrollment documentation for more information on these fields). This argument is ignored if the course is configured to hide final grades.“current_grading_period_scores”: Optional information to include with each Course. When current_grading_period_scores is given and total_scores is given, any student enrollments will also include the fields ‘has_grading_periods’, ‘totals_for_all_grading_periods_option’, ‘current_grading_period_title’, ‘current_grading_period_id’, current_period_computed_current_score’, ‘current_period_computed_final_score’, ‘current_period_computed_current_grade’, and ‘current_period_computed_final_grade’, as well as (if the user has permission) ‘current_period_unposted_current_score’, ‘current_period_unposted_final_score’, ‘current_period_unposted_current_grade’, and ‘current_period_unposted_final_grade’ (see Enrollment documentation for more information on these fields). In addition, when this argument is passed, the course will have a ‘has_grading_periods’ attribute on it. This argument is ignored if the total_scores argument is not included. If the course is configured to hide final grades, the following fields are not returned: ‘totals_for_all_grading_periods_option’, ‘current_period_computed_current_score’, ‘current_period_computed_final_score’, ‘current_period_computed_current_grade’, ‘current_period_computed_final_grade’, ‘current_period_unposted_current_score’, ‘current_period_unposted_final_score’, ‘current_period_unposted_current_grade’, and ‘current_period_unposted_final_grade’“grading_periods”: Optional information to include with each Course. When grading_periods is given, a list of the grading periods associated with each course is returned.“term”: Optional information to include with each Course. When term is given, the information for the enrollment term for each course is returned.“account”: Optional information to include with each Course. When account is given, the account json for each course is returned.“course_progress”: Optional information to include with each Course. When course_progress is given, each course will include a ‘course_progress’ object with the fields: ‘requirement_count’, an integer specifying the total number of requirements in the course, ‘requirement_completed_count’, an integer specifying the total number of requirements in this course that have been completed, and ‘next_requirement_url’, a string url to the next requirement item, and ‘completed_at’, the date the course was completed (null if incomplete). ‘next_requirement_url’ will be null if all requirements have been completed or the current module does not require sequential progress. “course_progress” will return an error message if the course is not module based or the user is not enrolled as a student in the course.“sections”: Section enrollment information to include with each Course. Returns an array of hashes containing the section ID (id), section name (name), start and end dates (start_at, end_at), as well as the enrollment type (enrollment_role, e.g. ‘StudentEnrollment’).“storage_quota_used_mb”: The amount of storage space used by the files in this course“total_students”: Optional information to include with each Course. Returns an integer for the total amount of active and invited students.“passback_status”: Include the grade passback_status“favorites”: Optional information to include with each Course. Indicates if the user has marked the course as a favorite course.“teachers”: Teacher information to include with each Course. Returns an array of hashes containing theUserDisplayinformation for each teacher in the course.“observed_users”: Optional information to include with each Course. Will include data for observed users if the current user has an observer enrollment.“tabs”: Optional information to include with each Course. Will include the list of tabs configured for each course. See theList available tabs APIfor more information.“course_image”: Optional information to include with each Course. Returns course image url if a course image has been set.“banner_image”: Optional information to include with each Course. Returns course banner image url if the course is a Canvas for Elementary subject and a banner image has been set.“concluded”: Optional information to include with each Course. Indicates whether the course has been concluded, taking course and term dates into account.“post_manually”: Optional information to include with each Course. Returns true if the course post policy is set to Manually post grades. Returns false if the the course post policy is set to Automatically post grades.Allowed values:needs_grading_count,syllabus_body,public_description,total_scores,current_grading_period_scores,grading_periods,term,account,course_progress,sections,storage_quota_used_mb,total_students,passback_status,favorites,teachers,observed_users,course_image,banner_image,concluded,post_manually

parameters.name: course[name]
parameters.description: The name of the course. If omitted, the course will be named “Unnamed Course.”

parameters.name: course[course_code]
parameters.description: The course code for the course.

parameters.name: course[start_at]
parameters.description: Course start date in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true.

parameters.name: course[end_at]
parameters.description: Course end date in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true.

parameters.name: course[license]
parameters.description: The name of the licensing. Should be one of the following abbreviations (a descriptive name is included in parenthesis for reference):‘private’ (Private Copyrighted)‘cc_by_nc_nd’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial No Derivatives)‘cc_by_nc_sa’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike)‘cc_by_nc’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial)‘cc_by_nd’ (CC Attribution No Derivatives)‘cc_by_sa’ (CC Attribution Share Alike)‘cc_by’ (CC Attribution)‘public_domain’ (Public Domain).

parameters.name: course[is_public]
parameters.description: Set to true if course is public to both authenticated and unauthenticated users.

parameters.name: course[is_public_to_auth_users]
parameters.description: Set to true if course is public only to authenticated users.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus public.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus_to_auth]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus public for authenticated users.

parameters.name: course[public_description]
parameters.description: A publicly visible description of the course.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_wiki_edits]
parameters.description: If true, students will be able to modify the course wiki.

parameters.name: course[allow_wiki_comments]
parameters.description: If true, course members will be able to comment on wiki pages.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_forum_attachments]
parameters.description: If true, students can attach files to forum posts.

parameters.name: course[open_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is open enrollment.

parameters.name: course[self_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is self enrollment.

parameters.name: course[restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates]
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the course. This value must be set to true in order to specify a course start date and/or end date.

parameters.name: course[term_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID of the term to create to course in.

parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier.

parameters.name: course[integration_id]

parameters.name: course[apply_assignment_group_weights]
parameters.description: Set to true to weight final grade based on assignment groups percentages.

parameters.name: course[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the course. Allowed time zones areIANA time zonesor friendlierRuby on Rails time zones.

parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course will be available to students immediately.

parameters.name: enroll_me
parameters.description: Set to true to enroll the current user as the teacher.

parameters.name: enrollment_role_id

This can be a role created with theAdd Role APIor a built_in role id with type ‘StudentEnrollment’, ‘TeacherEnrollment’, ‘TaEnrollment’, ‘ObserverEnrollment’, or ‘DesignerEnrollment’.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: “enrollments”:Optionally include with each Course the user’s current and invited enrollments. If the user is enrolled as a student, and the account has permission to manage or view all grades, each enrollment will include a ‘grades’ key with ‘current_score’, ‘final_score’, ‘current_grade’ and ‘final_grade’ values.“locked”: Optionally include whether an enrollment is locked.“avatar_url”: Optionally include avatar_url.“bio”: Optionally include each user’s bio.“test_student”: Optionally include the course’s Test Student,if present. Default is to not include Test Student.“custom_links”: Optionally include plugin-supplied custom links for each student,such as analytics information“current_grading_period_scores”: if enrollments is included aswell as this directive, the scores returned in the enrollment will be for the current grading period if there is one. A ‘grading_period_id’ value will also be included with the scores. if grading_period_id is nil there is no current grading period and the score is a total score.“uuid”: Optionally include the users uuidAllowed values:enrollments,locked,avatar_url,test_student,bio,custom_links,current_grading_period_scores,uuid

name: Update a course
description: Update an existing course.

parameters.name: course[account_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID of the account to move the course to.

parameters.name: course[name]
parameters.description: The name of the course. If omitted, the course will be named “Unnamed Course.”

parameters.name: course[course_code]
parameters.description: The course code for the course.

parameters.name: course[start_at]
parameters.description: Course start date in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true, or the course is already published.

parameters.name: course[end_at]
parameters.description: Course end date in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true.

parameters.name: course[license]
parameters.description: The name of the licensing. Should be one of the following abbreviations (a descriptive name is included in parenthesis for reference):‘private’ (Private Copyrighted)‘cc_by_nc_nd’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial No Derivatives)‘cc_by_nc_sa’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike)‘cc_by_nc’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial)‘cc_by_nd’ (CC Attribution No Derivatives)‘cc_by_sa’ (CC Attribution Share Alike)‘cc_by’ (CC Attribution)‘public_domain’ (Public Domain).

parameters.name: course[is_public]
parameters.description: Set to true if course is public to both authenticated and unauthenticated users.

parameters.name: course[is_public_to_auth_users]
parameters.description: Set to true if course is public only to authenticated users.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus public.

parameters.name: course[public_syllabus_to_auth]
parameters.description: Set to true to make the course syllabus to public for authenticated users.

parameters.name: course[public_description]
parameters.description: A publicly visible description of the course.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_wiki_edits]
parameters.description: If true, students will be able to modify the course wiki.

parameters.name: course[allow_wiki_comments]
parameters.description: If true, course members will be able to comment on wiki pages.

parameters.name: course[allow_student_forum_attachments]
parameters.description: If true, students can attach files to forum posts.

parameters.name: course[open_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is open enrollment.

parameters.name: course[self_enrollment]
parameters.description: Set to true if the course is self enrollment.

parameters.name: course[restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates]
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the course. Setting this value to false will remove the course end date (if it exists), as well as the course start date (if the course is unpublished).

parameters.name: course[term_id]
parameters.description: The unique ID of the term to create to course in.

parameters.name: course[sis_course_id]
parameters.description: The unique SIS identifier.

parameters.name: course[integration_id]
parameters.description: The unique Integration identifier.

parameters.name: course[hide_final_grades]
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the totals in student grades summary will be hidden.

parameters.name: course[time_zone]
parameters.description: The time zone for the course. Allowed time zones areIANA time zonesor friendlierRuby on Rails time zones.

parameters.name: course[apply_assignment_group_weights]
parameters.description: Set to true to weight final grade based on assignment groups percentages.

parameters.name: course[storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: Set the storage quota for the course, in megabytes. The caller must have the “Manage storage quotas” account permission.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course will be available to students immediately.

parameters.name: course[event]
parameters.description: The action to take on each course.‘claim’ makes a course no longer visible to students. This action is also called “unpublish” on the web site. A course cannot be unpublished if students have received graded submissions.‘offer’ makes a course visible to students. This action is also called “publish” on the web site.‘conclude’ prevents future enrollments and makes a course read-only for all participants. The course still appears in prior-enrollment lists.‘delete’ completely removes the course from the web site (including course menus and prior-enrollment lists). All enrollments are deleted. Course content may be physically deleted at a future date.‘undelete’ attempts to recover a course that has been deleted. This action requires account administrative rights. (Recovery is not guaranteed; please conclude rather than delete a course if there is any possibility the course will be used again.) The recovered course will be unpublished. Deleted enrollments will not be recovered.Allowed values:claim,offer,conclude,delete,undelete

parameters.name: course[default_view]
parameters.description: The type of page that users will see when they first visit the course‘feed’ Recent Activity Dashboard‘wiki’ Wiki Front Page‘modules’ Course Modules/Sections Page‘assignments’ Course Assignments List‘syllabus’ Course Syllabus Pageother types may be added in the futureAllowed values:feed,wiki,modules,syllabus,assignments

parameters.name: course[syllabus_body]
parameters.description: The syllabus body for the course

parameters.name: course[syllabus_course_summary]
parameters.description: Optional. Indicates whether the Course Summary (consisting of the course’s assignments and calendar events) is displayed on the syllabus page. Defaults totrue.

parameters.name: course[grading_standard_id]
parameters.description: The grading standard id to set for the course. If no value is provided for this argument the current grading_standard will be un-set from this course.

parameters.name: course[grade_passback_setting]
parameters.description: Optional. The grade_passback_setting for the course. Only ‘nightly_sync’ and ” are allowed

parameters.name: course[course_format]
parameters.description: Optional. Specifies the format of the course. (Should be either ‘on_campus’ or ‘online’)

parameters.name: course[image_id]
parameters.description: This is a file ID corresponding to an image file in the course that will be used as the course image. This will clear the course’s image_url setting if set. If you attempt to provide image_url and image_id in a request it will fail.

parameters.name: course[image_url]
parameters.description: This is a URL to an image to be used as the course image. This will clear the course’s image_id setting if set. If you attempt to provide image_url and image_id in a request it will fail.

parameters.name: course[remove_image]
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course image url and course image ID are both set to nil

parameters.name: course[remove_banner_image]
parameters.description: If this option is set to true, the course banner image url and course banner image ID are both set to nil

parameters.name: course[blueprint]
parameters.description: Sets the course as a blueprint course.

parameters.name: course[blueprint_restrictions]
parameters.description: Sets a default set to apply to blueprint course objects when restricted, unlessuse_blueprint_restrictions_by_object_typeis enabled. See theBlueprint Restrictiondocumentation

parameters.name: course[use_blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type]
parameters.description: When enabled, theblueprint_restrictionsparameter will be ignored in favor of theblueprint_restrictions_by_object_typeparameter

parameters.name: course[blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type]
parameters.description: Allows setting multipleBlueprint Restrictionto apply to blueprint course objects of the matching type when restricted. The possible object types are “assignment”, “attachment”, “discussion_topic”, “quiz” and “wiki_page”. Example usage:course[blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type][assignment][content]=1

parameters.name: course[homeroom_course]
parameters.description: Sets the course as a homeroom course. The setting takes effect only when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account.

parameters.name: course[sync_enrollments_from_homeroom]
parameters.description: Syncs enrollments from the homeroom that is set in homeroom_course_id. The setting only takes effect when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account and sync_enrollments_from_homeroom is enabled.

parameters.name: course[homeroom_course_id]
parameters.description: Sets the Homeroom Course id to be used with sync_enrollments_from_homeroom. The setting only takes effect when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account and sync_enrollments_from_homeroom is enabled.

parameters.name: course[template]
parameters.description: Enable or disable the course as a template that can be selected by an account

parameters.name: course[course_color]
parameters.description: Sets a color in hex code format to be associated with the course. The setting takes effect only when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account.

parameters.name: course[friendly_name]
parameters.description: Set a friendly name for the course. If this is provided and the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary account, it will be shown instead of the course name. This setting takes priority over course nicknames defined by individual users.

parameters.name: course[enable_course_paces]
parameters.description: Enable or disable Course Pacing for the course. This setting only has an effect when the Course Pacing feature flag is enabled for the sub-account. Otherwise, Course Pacing are always disabled.Note: Course Pacing is in active development.

parameters.name: course[conditional_release]
parameters.description: Enable or disable individual learning paths for students based on assessment

parameters.name: course[post_manually]
parameters.description: When true, all grades in the course will be posted manually. When false, all grades in the course will be automatically posted. Use with caution as this setting will override any assignment level post policy.

parameters.name: override_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness

name: Permissions
description: Returns permission information for the calling user and the given account. You may use ‘self` as the account id to check permissions against the domain root account. The caller must have an account role or admin (teacher/TA/designer) enrollment in a course in the account.

parameters.name: permissions[]
parameters.description: List of permissions to check against the authenticated user. Permission names are documented in theCreate a roleendpoint.

name: Get the sub-accounts of an account
description: List accounts that are sub-accounts of the given account.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: If true, the entire account tree underneath this account will be returned (though still paginated). If false, only direct sub-accounts of this account will be returned. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional information to include.“course_count”returns the number of courses directly under each account“sub_account_count”returns the number of sub-accounts directly under each accountAllowed values:course_count,sub_account_count

name: Get the Terms of Service
description: Returns the terms of service for that account

parameters.name: with_enrollments
parameters.description: If true, include only courses with at least one enrollment. If false, include only courses with no enrollments. If not present, do not filter on course enrollment status.

parameters.name: enrollment_type[]
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that have at least one user enrolled in in the course with one of the specified enrollment types.Allowed values:teacher,student,ta,observer,designer

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: If true, include only published courses. If false, exclude published courses. If not present, do not filter on published status.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description: If true, include only completed courses (these may be in state ‘completed’, or their enrollment term may have ended). If false, exclude completed courses. If not present, do not filter on completed status.

parameters.name: blueprint
parameters.description: If true, include only blueprint courses. If false, exclude them. If not present, do not filter on this basis.

parameters.name: blueprint_associated
parameters.description: If true, include only courses that inherit content from a blueprint course. If false, exclude them. If not present, do not filter on this basis.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: If true, include only public courses. If false, exclude them. If not present, do not filter on this basis.

parameters.name: by_teachers[]
parameters.description: List of User IDs of teachers; if supplied, include only courses taught by one of the referenced users.

parameters.name: by_subaccounts[]
parameters.description: List of Account IDs; if supplied, include only courses associated with one of the referenced subaccounts.

parameters.name: hide_enrollmentless_courses
parameters.description: If present, only return courses that have at least one enrollment. Equivalent to ‘with_enrollments=true’; retained for compatibility.

parameters.name: state[]
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that are in the given state(s). By default, all states but “deleted” are returned.Allowed values:created,claimed,available,completed,deleted,all

parameters.name: enrollment_term_id
parameters.description: If set, only includes courses from the specified term.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial course name, code, or full ID to match and return in the results list. Must be at least 3 characters.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: All explanations can be seen in theCourse API index documentation“sections”, “needs_grading_count” and “total_scores” are not valid options at the account levelAllowed values:syllabus_body,term,course_progress,storage_quota_used_mb,total_students,teachers,account_name,concluded,post_manually

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The column to sort results by.Allowed values:course_status,course_name,sis_course_id,teacher,account_name

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order to sort the given column by.Allowed values:asc,desc

parameters.name: search_by
parameters.description: The filter to search by. “course” searches for course names, course codes, and SIS IDs. “teacher” searches for teacher namesAllowed values:course,teacher

parameters.name: starts_before
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that start before the value (inclusive) or their enrollment term starts before the value (inclusive) or both the course’s start_at and the enrollment term’s start_at are set to null. The value should be formatted as: yyyy-mm-dd or ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: ends_after
parameters.description: If set, only return courses that end after the value (inclusive) or their enrollment term ends after the value (inclusive) or both the course’s end_at and the enrollment term’s end_at are set to null. The value should be formatted as: yyyy-mm-dd or ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.description: If set, only return homeroom courses.

name: Update an account
description: Update an existing account.

parameters.name: account[name]
parameters.description: Updates the account name

parameters.name: account[sis_account_id]
parameters.description: Updates the account sis_account_id Must have manage_sis permission and must not be a root_account.

parameters.name: account[default_time_zone]
parameters.description: The default time zone of the account. Allowed time zones areIANA time zonesor friendlierRuby on Rails time zones.

parameters.name: account[default_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default course storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_user_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default user storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_group_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default group storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[course_template_id]
parameters.description: The ID of a course to be used as a template for all newly created courses. Empty means to inherit the setting from parent account, 0 means to not use a template even if a parent account has one set. The course must be marked as a template.

parameters.name: account[parent_account_id]
parameters.description: The ID of a parent account to move the account to. The new parent account must be in the same root account as the original. The hierarchy of sub-accounts will be preserved in the new parent account. The caller must be an administrator in both the original parent account and the new parent account.

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_past_view][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing courses after end date

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_past_view][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_view][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing courses before start date

parameters.name: account[settings][microsoft_sync_enabled]
parameters.description: Determines whether this account has Microsoft Teams Sync enabled or not.Note that if you are altering Microsoft Teams sync settings you must enable the Microsoft Group enrollment syncing feature flag. In addition, if you are enabling Microsoft Teams sync, you must also specify a tenant, login attribute, and a remote attribute. Specifying a suffix to use is optional.

parameters.name: account[settings][microsoft_sync_tenant]
parameters.description: The tenant this account should use when using Microsoft Teams Sync. This should be an Azure Active Directory domain name.

parameters.name: account[settings][microsoft_sync_login_attribute]
parameters.description: The attribute this account should use to lookup users when using Microsoft Teams Sync. Must be one of “sub”, “email”, “oid”, “preferred_username”, or “integration_id”.

parameters.name: account[settings][microsoft_sync_login_attribute_suffix]
parameters.description: A suffix that will be appended to the result of the login attribute when associating Canvas users with Microsoft users. Must be under 255 characters and contain no whitespace. This field is optional.

parameters.name: account[settings][microsoft_sync_remote_attribute]
parameters.description: The Active Directory attribute to use when associating Canvas users with Microsoft users. Must be one of “mail”, “mailNickname”, or “userPrincipalName”.

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_view][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][lock_all_announcements][value]
parameters.description: Disable comments on announcements

parameters.name: account[settings][lock_all_announcements][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][usage_rights_required][value]
parameters.description: Copyright and license information must be provided for files before they are published.

parameters.name: account[settings][usage_rights_required][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_listing][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing future enrollments in course list

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_listing][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][conditional_release][value]
parameters.description: Enable or disable individual learning paths for students based on assessment

parameters.name: account[settings][conditional_release][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][password_policy]
parameters.description: Hash of optional password policy configuration parameters for a root accountallow_login_suspensionbooleanAllow suspension of user logins upon reaching maximum_login_attemptsrequire_number_charactersbooleanRequire the use of number characters when setting up a new passwordrequire_symbol_charactersbooleanRequire the use of symbol characters when setting up a new passwordminimum_character_lengthintegerMinimum number of characters required for a new passwordmaximum_login_attemptsintegerMaximum number of login attempts before a user is locked outRequiredfeature option:Enhancepasswordoptions

parameters.name: account[settings][enable_as_k5_account][value]
parameters.description: Enable or disable Canvas for Elementary for this account

parameters.name: account[settings][use_classic_font_in_k5][value]
parameters.description: Whether or not the classic font is used on the dashboard. Only applies if enable_as_k5_account is true.

parameters.name: override_sis_stickiness
parameters.description: Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness

parameters.name: account[settings][lock_outcome_proficiency][value]
parameters.description: DEPRECATEDRestrict instructors from changing mastery scale

parameters.name: account[lock_outcome_proficiency][locked]
parameters.description: DEPRECATEDLock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][lock_proficiency_calculation][value]
parameters.description: DEPRECATEDRestrict instructors from changing proficiency calculation method

parameters.name: account[lock_proficiency_calculation][locked]
parameters.description: DEPRECATEDLock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.description: Give this a set of keys and boolean values to enable or disable services matching the keys

name: Delete a sub-account
description: Cannot delete an account with active courses or active sub_accounts. Cannot delete a root_account

name: List enrollments
description: Depending on the URL given, return a paginated list of either (1) all of the enrollments in a course, (2) all of the enrollments in a section or (3) all of a user’s enrollments. This includes student, teacher, TA, and observer enrollments.

parameters.name: type[]
parameters.description: A list of enrollment types to return. Accepted values are ‘StudentEnrollment’, ‘TeacherEnrollment’, ‘TaEnrollment’, ‘DesignerEnrollment’, and ‘ObserverEnrollment.’ If omitted, all enrollment types are returned. This argument is ignored if ‘role` is given.

parameters.name: role[]
parameters.description: A list of enrollment roles to return. Accepted values include course-level roles created by theAdd Role APIas well as the base enrollment types accepted by the ‘type` argument above.

parameters.name: state[]
parameters.description: Filter by enrollment state. If omitted, ‘active’ and ‘invited’ enrollments are returned. The following synthetic states are supported only when querying a user’s enrollments (either via user_id argument or via user enrollments endpoint):current_and_invited,current_and_future,current_future_and_restricted,current_and_concludedAllowed values:active,invited,creation_pending,deleted,rejected,completed,inactive,current_and_invited,current_and_future,current_future_and_restricted,current_and_concluded

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional information to include on the enrollment or user records. “avatar_url” and “group_ids” will be returned on the user record. If “current_points” is specified, the fields “current_points” and (if the caller has permissions to manage grades) “unposted_current_points” will be included in the “grades” hash for student enrollments.Allowed values:avatar_url,group_ids,locked,observed_users,can_be_removed,uuid,current_points

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Filter by user_id (only valid for course or section enrollment queries). If set to the current user’s id, this is a way to determine if the user has any enrollments in the course or section, independent of whether the user has permission to view other people on the roster.

parameters.name: grading_period_id
parameters.description: Return grades for the given grading_period. If this parameter is not specified, the returned grades will be for the whole course.

parameters.name: enrollment_term_id
parameters.description: Returns only enrollments for the specified enrollment term. This parameter only applies to the user enrollments path. May pass the ID from the enrollment terms api or the SIS id prepended with ‘sis_term_id:’.

parameters.name: sis_account_id[]
parameters.description: Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS account ID(s). Does not look into sub_accounts. May pass in array or string.

parameters.name: sis_course_id[]
parameters.description: Returns only enrollments matching the specified SIS course ID(s). May pass in array or string.

parameters.name: sis_section_id[]
parameters.description: Returns only section enrollments matching the specified SIS section ID(s). May pass in array or string.

parameters.name: sis_user_id[]
parameters.description: Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS user ID(s). May pass in array or string.

parameters.name: created_for_sis_id[]
parameters.description: If sis_user_id is present and created_for_sis_id is true, Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS ID(s). If a user has two sis_id’s, one enrollment may be created using one of the two ids. This would limit the enrollments returned from the endpoint to enrollments that were created from a sis_import with that sis_user_id

name: Enrollment by ID
description: Get an Enrollment object by Enrollment ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: integer

name: Enroll a user
description: Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.

parameters.name: enrollment[start_at]
parameters.description: The start time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2012-04-18T23:08:51Z

parameters.name: enrollment[end_at]
parameters.description: The end time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2012-04-18T23:08:51Z

parameters.name: enrollment[user_id]
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: enrollment[type]
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: enrollment[role]
parameters.description: Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.

parameters.name: enrollment[role_id]
parameters.description: Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.

parameters.name: enrollment[enrollment_state]
parameters.description: If set to ‘active,’ student will be immediately enrolled in the course. Otherwise they will be required to accept a course invitation. Default is ‘invited.’.If set to ‘inactive’, student will be listed in the course roster for teachers, but will not be able to participate in the course until their enrollment is activated.Allowed values:active,invited,inactive

parameters.name: enrollment[course_section_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the course section to enroll the student in. If the section-specific URL is used, this argument is redundant and will be ignored.

parameters.name: enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section]
parameters.description: If set, the enrollment will only allow the user to see and interact with users enrolled in the section given by course_section_id.For teachers and TAs, this includes grading privileges.Section-limited students will not see any users (including teachers and TAs) not enrolled in their sections.Users may have other enrollments that grant privileges to multiple sections in the same course.

parameters.name: enrollment[notify]
parameters.description: If true, a notification will be sent to the enrolled user. Notifications are not sent by default.

parameters.name: enrollment[self_enrollment_code]
parameters.description: If the current user is not allowed to manage enrollments in this course, but the course allows self-enrollment, the user can self- enroll as a student in the default section by passing in a valid code. When self-enrolling, the user_id must be ‘self’. The enrollment_state will be set to ‘active’ and all other arguments will be ignored.

parameters.name: enrollment[self_enrolled]
parameters.description: If true, marks the enrollment as a self-enrollment, which gives students the ability to drop the course if desired. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: enrollment[associated_user_id]
parameters.description: For an observer enrollment, the ID of a student to observe. This is a one-off operation; to automatically observe all a student’s enrollments (for example, as a parent), please use theUser Observees API.

parameters.name: enrollment[sis_user_id]
parameters.description: Required if the user is being enrolled from another trusted account. The unique identifier for the user (sis_user_id) must also be accompanied by the root_account parameter. The user_id will be ignored.

parameters.name: enrollment[integration_id]
parameters.description: Required if the user is being enrolled from another trusted account. The unique identifier for the user (integration_id) must also be accompanied by the root_account parameter. The user_id will be ignored.

parameters.name: root_account
parameters.description: The domain of the account to search for the user. Will be a no-op unless the sis_user_id or integration_id parameter is also included.

name: Conclude, deactivate, or delete an enrollment
description: Conclude, deactivate, or delete an enrollment. If thetaskargument isn’t given, the enrollment will be concluded.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: The action to take on the enrollment. When inactive, a user will still appear in the course roster to admins, but be unable to participate. (“inactivate” and “deactivate” are equivalent tasks)Allowed values:conclude,delete,inactivate,deactivate

name: Create an assignment
description: Create a new assignment for this course. The assignment is created in the active state.

parameters.name: assignment[name]
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: assignment[position]
parameters.description: The position of this assignment in the group when displaying assignment lists.

parameters.name: assignment[submission_types][]
parameters.description:
List of supported submission types for the assignment. Unless the assignment is allowing online submissions, the array should only have one element.If not allowing online submissions, your options are:"online_quiz""none""on_paper""discussion_topic""external_tool"If you are allowing online submissions, you can have one or many allowed submission types:"online_upload"
"online_text_entry"
"online_url"
"media_recording" (Only valid when the Kaltura plugin is enabled)
"student_annotation"Allowed values:online_quiz,none,on_paper,discussion_topic,external_tool,online_upload,online_text_entry,online_url,media_recording,student_annotation

parameters.name: assignment[allowed_extensions][]
parameters.description: Allowed extensions if submission_types includes “online_upload”Example:allowed_extensions: ["docx","ppt"]

parameters.name: assignment[turnitin_enabled]
parameters.description: Only applies when the Turnitin plugin is enabled for a course and the submission_types array includes “online_upload”. Toggles Turnitin submissions for the assignment. Will be ignored if Turnitin is not available for the course.

parameters.name: assignment[vericite_enabled]
parameters.description: Only applies when the VeriCite plugin is enabled for a course and the submission_types array includes “online_upload”. Toggles VeriCite submissions for the assignment. Will be ignored if VeriCite is not available for the course.

parameters.name: assignment[turnitin_settings]
parameters.description: Settings to send along to turnitin. See Assignment object definition for format.

parameters.name: assignment[integration_data]
parameters.description: Data used for SIS integrations. Requires admin-level token with the “Manage SIS” permission. JSON string required.

parameters.name: assignment[integration_id]
parameters.description: Unique ID from third party integrations

parameters.name: assignment[peer_reviews]
parameters.description: If submission_types does not include external_tool,discussion_topic, online_quiz, or on_paper, determines whether or not peer reviews will be turned on for the assignment.

parameters.name: assignment[automatic_peer_reviews]
parameters.description: Whether peer reviews will be assigned automatically by Canvas or if teachers must manually assign peer reviews. Does not apply if peer reviews are not enabled.

parameters.name: assignment[notify_of_update]
parameters.description: If true, Canvas will send a notification to students in the class notifying them that the content has changed.

parameters.name: assignment[group_category_id]
parameters.description: If present, the assignment will become a group assignment assigned to the group.

parameters.name: assignment[grade_group_students_individually]
parameters.description: If this is a group assignment, teachers have the options to grade students individually. If false, Canvas will apply the assignment’s score to each member of the group. If true, the teacher can manually assign scores to each member of the group.

parameters.name: assignment[external_tool_tag_attributes]
parameters.description: Hash of external tool parameters if submission_types is [“external_tool”]. See Assignment object definition for format.

parameters.name: assignment[points_possible]
parameters.description: The maximum points possible on the assignment.

parameters.name: assignment[grading_type]
parameters.description: The strategy used for grading the assignment. The assignment defaults to “points” if this field is omitted.Allowed values:pass_fail,percent,letter_grade,gpa_scale,points,not_graded

parameters.name: assignment[due_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the assignment is due. Must be between the lock dates if there are lock dates. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: assignment[lock_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the assignment is locked after. Must be after the due date if there is a due date. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: assignment[unlock_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the assignment is unlocked. Must be before the due date if there is a due date. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z.

parameters.name: assignment[description]
parameters.description: The assignment’s description, supports HTML.

parameters.name: assignment[assignment_group_id]
parameters.description: The assignment group id to put the assignment in. Defaults to the top assignment group in the course.

parameters.name: assignment[assignment_overrides][]
parameters.description: List of overrides for the assignment.

parameters.name: assignment[only_visible_to_overrides]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment is only visible to overrides (Only useful if ‘differentiated assignments’ account setting is on)

parameters.name: assignment[published]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment is published. (Only useful if ‘draft state’ account setting is on) Unpublished assignments are not visible to students.

parameters.name: assignment[grading_standard_id]
parameters.description: The grading standard id to set for the course. If no value is provided for this argument the current grading_standard will be un-set from this course. This will update the grading_type for the course to ‘letter_grade’ unless it is already ‘gpa_scale’.

parameters.name: assignment[omit_from_final_grade]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment is counted towards a student’s final grade.

parameters.name: assignment[hide_in_gradebook]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment is shown in the gradebook.

parameters.name: assignment[quiz_lti]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment should use the Quizzes 2 LTI tool. Sets the submission type to ‘external_tool’ and configures the external tool attributes to use the Quizzes 2 LTI tool configured for this course. Has no effect if no Quizzes 2 LTI tool is configured.

parameters.name: assignment[moderated_grading]
parameters.description: Whether this assignment is moderated.

parameters.name: assignment[grader_count]
parameters.description: The maximum number of provisional graders who may issue grades for this assignment. Only relevant for moderated assignments. Must be a positive value, and must be set to 1 if the course has fewer than two active instructors. Otherwise, the maximum value is the number of active instructors in the course minus one, or 10 if the course has more than 11 active instructors.

parameters.name: assignment[final_grader_id]
parameters.description: The user ID of the grader responsible for choosing final grades for this assignment. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

parameters.name: assignment[grader_comments_visible_to_graders]
parameters.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders’ comments are visible to other provisional graders. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

parameters.name: assignment[graders_anonymous_to_graders]
parameters.description: Boolean indicating if provisional graders’ identities are hidden from other provisional graders. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

parameters.name: assignment[graders_names_visible_to_final_grader]
parameters.description: Boolean indicating if provisional grader identities are visible to the the final grader. Only relevant for moderated assignments.

parameters.name: assignment[anonymous_grading]
parameters.description: Boolean indicating if the assignment is graded anonymously. If true, graders cannot see student identities.

parameters.name: assignment[allowed_attempts]
parameters.description: The number of submission attempts allowed for this assignment. Set to -1 for unlimited attempts.

parameters.name: assignment[annotatable_attachment_id]
parameters.description: The Attachment ID of the document being annotated.Only applies when submission_types includes “student_annotation”.

name: Bulk update assignment dates
description: Update due dates and availability dates for multiple assignments in a course.

parameters.name: assignment_override[student_ids][]
parameters.description: The IDs of the override’s target students. If present, the IDs must each identify a user with an active student enrollment in the course that is not already targetted by a different adhoc override.

parameters.name: assignment_override[title]
parameters.description: The title of the adhoc assignment override. Required if student_ids is present, ignored otherwise (the title is set to the name of the targetted group or section instead).

parameters.name: assignment_override[group_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the override’s target group. If present, the following conditions must be met for the override to be successful:the assignment MUST be a group assignment (a group_category_id is assigned to it)the ID must identify an active group in the group set the assignment is inthe ID must not be targetted by a different overrideSeeAppendix: Group assignmentsfor more info.

parameters.name: assignment_override[course_section_id]
parameters.description: The ID of the override’s target section. If present, must identify an active section of the assignment’s course not already targetted by a different override.

parameters.name: assignment_override[due_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the overridden assignment is due. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z. If absent, this override will not affect due date. May be present but null to indicate the override removes any previous due date.

parameters.name: assignment_override[unlock_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the overridden assignment becomes unlocked. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z. If absent, this override will not affect the unlock date. May be present but null to indicate the override removes any previous unlock date.

parameters.name: assignment_override[lock_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the overridden assignment becomes locked. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z. If absent, this override will not affect the lock date. May be present but null to indicate the override removes any previous lock date.

parameters.description: The day/time the overridden assignment is due. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z. If absent, this override will not affect due date. May be present but null to indicate the override removes any previous due date.

parameters.name: assignment_override[unlock_at]
parameters.description: The day/time the overridden assignment becomes unlocked. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2014-10-21T18:48:00Z. If absent, this override will not affect the unlock date. May be present but null to indicate the override removes any previous unlock date.

parameters.name: assignment_override[lock_at]

name: Submit an assignment
description: Make a submission for an assignment. You must be actively enrolled as a student in the course/section to do this. Concluded and pending enrollments are not permitted.

parameters.name: comment[text_comment]
parameters.description: Include a textual comment with the submission.

parameters.name: submission[group_comment]
parameters.description: Whether or not this comment should be sent to the entire group (defaults to false). Ignored if this is not a group assignment or if no text_comment is provided.

parameters.name: submission[submission_type]
parameters.description: string

parameters.name: submission[body]
parameters.description: Submit the assignment as an HTML document snippet. Note this HTML snippet will be sanitized using the same ruleset as a submission made from the Canvas web UI. The sanitized HTML will be returned in the response as the submission body. Requires a submission_type of “online_text_entry”.

parameters.name: submission[url]
parameters.description: Submit the assignment as a URL. The URL scheme must be “http” or “https”, no “ftp” or other URL schemes are allowed. If no scheme is given (e.g. “www.example.com”) then “http” will be assumed. Requires a submission_type of “online_url” or “basic_lti_launch”.

parameters.name: submission[file_ids][]
parameters.description: Submit the assignment as a set of one or more previously uploaded files residing in the submitting user’s files section (or the group’s files section, for group assignments).To upload a new file to submit, see the submissionsUpload a file API.Requires a submission_type of “online_upload”.

parameters.name: submission[media_comment_id]
parameters.description: The media comment id to submit. Media comment ids can be submitted via this API, however, note that there is not yet an API to generate or list existing media comments, so this functionality is currently of limited use.Requires a submission_type of “media_recording”.

parameters.name: submission[media_comment_type]
parameters.description: The type of media comment being submitted.Allowed values:audio,video

parameters.name: submission[user_id]
parameters.description: Submit on behalf of the given user. Requires grading permission.

parameters.name: submission[annotatable_attachment_id]
parameters.description: The Attachment ID of the document being annotated. This should match the annotatable_attachment_id on the assignment.Requires a submission_type of “student_annotation”.

parameters.name: submission[submitted_at]
parameters.description: Choose the time the submission is listed as submitted at. Requires grading permission.

name: List assignment submissions
description: A paginated list of all existing submissions for an assignment.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Associations to include with the group. “group” will add group_id and group_name.Allowed values:submission_history,submission_comments,submission_html_comments,rubric_assessment,assignment,visibility,course,user,group,read_status,student_entered_score

parameters.name: grouped
parameters.description: If this argument is true, the response will be grouped by student groups.

name: List submissions for multiple assignments
description: A paginated list of all existing submissions for a given set of students and assignments.

parameters.name: student_ids[]
parameters.description: List of student ids to return submissions for. If this argument is omitted, return submissions for the calling user. Students may only list their own submissions. Observers may only list those of associated students. The special id “all” will return submissions for all students in the course/section as appropriate.

parameters.name: assignment_ids[]
parameters.description: List of assignments to return submissions for. If none are given, submissions for all assignments are returned.

parameters.name: grouped
parameters.description: If this argument is present, the response will be grouped by student, rather than a flat array of submissions.

parameters.name: post_to_sis
parameters.description: If this argument is set to true, the response will only include submissions for assignments that have the post_to_sis flag set to true and user enrollments that were added through sis.

parameters.name: submitted_since
parameters.description: If this argument is set, the response will only include submissions that were submitted after the specified date_time. This will exclude submissions that do not have a submitted_at which will exclude unsubmitted submissions. The value must be formatted as ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: graded_since
parameters.description: If this argument is set, the response will only include submissions that were graded after the specified date_time. This will exclude submissions that have not been graded. The value must be formatted as ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: grading_period_id
parameters.description: The id of the grading period in which submissions are being requested (Requires grading periods to exist on the account)

parameters.name: workflow_state
parameters.description: The current status of the submissionAllowed values:submitted,unsubmitted,graded,pending_review

parameters.name: enrollment_state
parameters.description: The current state of the enrollments. If omitted will include all enrollments that are not deleted.Allowed values:active,concluded

parameters.name: state_based_on_date
parameters.description: If omitted it is set to true. When set to false it will ignore the effective state of the student enrollments and use the workflow_state for the enrollments. The argument is ignored unless enrollment_state argument is also passed.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order submissions will be returned in. Defaults to “id”. Doesn’t affect results for “grouped” mode.Allowed values:id,graded_at

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description: Determines whether ordered results are returned in ascending or descending order. Defaults to “ascending”. Doesn’t affect results for “grouped” mode.Allowed values:ascending,descending

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Associations to include with the group. ‘total_scores` requires the `grouped` argument.Allowed values:submission_history,submission_comments,submission_html_comments,rubric_assessment,assignment,total_scores,visibility,course,user,sub_assignment_submissions,student_entered_score

name: Get a single submission
description: Get a single submission, based on user id.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Associations to include with the group.Allowed values:submission_history,submission_comments,submission_html_comments,rubric_assessment,full_rubric_assessment,visibility,course,user,read_status,student_entered_score

name: Get a single submission by anonymous id
description: Get a single submission, based on the submission’s anonymous id.
